conclusion: On a straight highway, two cars, Car A and Car B, start simultaneously from the same position and move in the same direction with uniform accelerated linear motion.
The graph shows the variation of the square of their velocities with displacement.
The slope of the line in a v^2 vs. x graph represents the acceleration of the car, derived from the formula v^2 = u^2 + 2ax.
The initial velocity (u) is zero since both cars start from rest.
The graph shows two lines, one for Car A and one for Car B.
The line representing Car A is steeper than the line representing Car B.

premise: The slope of the line in a v^2 vs. x graph represents the acceleration.
conclusion: Car A has a greater acceleration than Car B because its line is steeper.
